headline: freezing rain warning in effect
description:
Patchy freezing rain likely late this morning and afternoon.

What: 
Patchy freezing rain giving locally 1 to 2 mm of ice accretion.
Icy and slippery surfaces.

When:
Late this morning into the afternoon.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain is expected to affect portions of the area later this morning into the afternoon. Freezing rain amounts are not expected to be overly significant, but untreated surfaces are likely to become icy and slippery. Temperatures should rise above the freezing mark later this afternoon.

For areas well to the north of Fraserdale, temperatures may remain just below the freezing mark until later tonight. As a result, the threat of freezing rain may continue tonight.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.
